creator: weigelt@metux.de
text:
For string formatting (printf) of certain types, ie. size_t, there's an
configure check using AC_TRY_RUN how wide the type actually is. This breaks
crosscompiling - AC_TRY_RUN cannot work when crosscompiling.

Solution: always use %ld and simply cast all printf arguments to long.

Please propose large design changes like this on dev@apr not the bug tracking
system.
